intro: Secamone erythradenia, commonly known as red-veined secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with prominent red veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming during the wet season. The plant is often found in shaded, moist habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
